Yes, the filibuster has historically been used to block civil rights legislation.

Yes, Republicans have created their own carve-outs to the filibuster ‚Äî and it wasn‚Äôt even that long ago.

Yes, it‚Äôs time to #EndTheFilibuster.

Just so we‚Äôre all on the same page:

No, the filibuster is not in the Constitution.

No, the filibuster has not existed since the creation of the Senate.

No, the filibuster does not foster bipartisanship when it‚Äôs abused to cheat our democratic system.

I worked for Joe Biden when he chaired the Senate Foreign Relations Committee. Believe me when I say this:

His love for the Senate and his commitment to its founding purpose are unparalleled in DC. 

He supports changes to the filibuster not in spite of this ‚Äî but because of it.

For a decade, we‚Äôve fought off one Republican attack on the Affordable Care Act after another. 

This is why.

Today, the ACA is covering more Americans than ever before‚Äîincluding 4.6 million new enrollees just this year. https://t.co/eAfYwI3nfo
Let‚Äôs go forward confident and full of hope. Let‚Äôs make hope and history rhyme.

More to be done for sure. 

But our agenda stands in sharp contrast to the conspiracy-enabling, anti-vax,¬†Democracy-suppressing, vigilante anti-choice zealots and economic reactionaries who‚Äôve turned the party of Lincoln into a death cult.
We are holding insurrectionists accountable, we have vaccinated two thirds of Americans, and we have returned civility to the White House.

We passed a huge Covid-relief bill in March and a transformative infrastructure bill this fall. 

Unemployment has plummeted to 4.2% years ahead of schedule and GDP is growing at a very high rate.

I‚Äôm so tired of the dark and gloomy prognostications for Democrats.
